result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael E Cox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
** Pay DNA sucharges.
** Pay restitution plus surcharges.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to pay child support and make all court appearances.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Agent David Poulsen present.  Deft reports he has been unable to work for approx 1yr due to medical issues.  Brief discussion held.  No further court action taken at this time.
DOC's paperwork reflects the deft is homeless; Per voice mail message from Agent David Paulson - send deft's NOH to his attention; he will ensure the deft gets notice of the hrg.
